solution: To begin, see that if the ratio of the height of the cone to the height of the cylinder is 1:2, then the ratio of the cone height to the entire silo height is 1:3.  Therefore, the height of the cone is $27/3=9$ meters and the height of the cylinder is $18$ meters.  We can now use the formulas for the volume of a cylinder and the volume of a cone, with our given radius of 5: $$V_{cone}=\frac{1}{3}\cdot b \cdot h=\frac{1}{3}\cdot (\pi\cdot 5^2)\cdot 9=75\pi$$$$V_{cylinder}=\pi r^2\cdot h=\pi 5^2\cdot 18=450\pi$$$$V_{silo}=V_{cone}+V_{cylinder}=75\pi+450\pi=\boxed{525\pi}.$$
